850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:28): Writeress: make a stand, refuse IE
66a119b422892dad76f8ceb67e33085e (22:28): they say more than 50% of net users are still using IE
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:29): More than 80% actually
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:29): It's usually estimated around 85%
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:29): Opera identifies itself as IE
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:29): With Firefox at around 10% and the rest totalling around 5%
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:29): so anything but a javascript detection of the browser is gonna give a false IE
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:29): Seriema: No, that's a myth
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:29): Nanobot: wikipedia says so!
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:29): Seriema: Opera doesn't fool statistics systems
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:30): Opera identifies itself as IE so you'll get access to IE only sites
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:30): so why wouldn't it fool a badly made statistics?
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:30): http://www.webdevout.net/opera_myths.php#usage
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:30): besides, 68.49% of all statistics are made up at the spot
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:30): Most statistics you hear in the news aren't badly made
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:31): Well, in regard to browser usage anyway
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:31): The biggest variable is probably the types of websites that use the statistics tracking software
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:31): Different firms market to different sizes of websites, and different sizes of websites may naturally show different results
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:31): Nanobot: nice link
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:33): you should update that technology table for opera 9 though
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:33): even though you mention it below
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:33): I know. I'm doing some major reconstruction work on the site, and a lot of fresh content will appear in the not-so-distant future
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:34): Currently, the site that's up is more or less frozen
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:34): well I'm going to design my page for FF and Opera, to hell with IE. but then again, it's my personal site so who cares :P
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:34): Right now I'm writing an SGML/CSS/ECMAScript parser/highlighter to be used in a lot of areas on the site
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:35): what are you writing it in?
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:35): Seriema: Feel free to use this: http://www.webdevout.net/browser_warning.php
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:35): PHP, because that's what my site is written in
37aec973c7d1f3f84544a6ea1fd8ff24 (22:35): hi, i have a question about scrollbar- options
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:35): It's reasonably fast
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:35): There are no scrollbar-styling CSS properties
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:35): oh WOW! thanks for that link! gimme a min
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:35): There are some proprietary violations of the CSS spec that IE supports
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:36): Seriema: Information on how to use it on your site is provided at the bottom
37aec973c7d1f3f84544a6ea1fd8ff24 (22:36): Nanobot: howcome i can find some info on css and scrollbar
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:36): I'm currently using CC to trap IE browsers
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:36): bart_: Because IE supports it, but no one else

01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:36): bart_: And in fact, the way that IE supports it is a direct violation of the CSS standard. They're supposed to name proprietary properties with a - or _ at the beginning
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:37): The way they currently named it complicates the formation of a standard
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:38): And generally, people like their interface controls to look like what they expect, not whatever the website owners wants
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:38): `doctype html4trans @ reisio
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (22:38): reisio, doctype html4trans: <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (22:38): Nanobot: http://www.seriema.net/ ^^

c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (22:41): doctype html4strict: <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:41): `doctype html4trans
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (22:41): doctype html4trans: <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:44): Nanobot, heh, you think MS honestly cares if they name properties how the w3c wants?
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:45): Zeros: Not enough to remove the properties or rename them, but they have started caring more about W3C standards lately.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:45): doesn't mean much after 5 years of no updates :p
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:45): Aww, I didn't add that :P
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:45): Is there a formalized doctype for XHTML2?
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:45): or is it still a draft spec
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:46): It's still a working draft
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (22:46): Zeros: No, there isn't.
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:46): A new draft was recently published
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (22:46): Zeros: I seem to recall some mention that there won't be either.
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (22:46): How do you validate a document without a doctype?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (22:46): Nanobot: Using a scheme or RELAX or some such.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (22:46): schema*
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:47): well the xml namespace you define on the document element would describe what the page was supposed to be in terms of markup
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:47): and XHTML2 won't have things like transitional or frameset
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:47): still seems odd to not use a doctype though
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (22:48): Doctypes don't play well with mixed namespaces
